6-7-15: Pine Tree Mobile Home Court Rules And Regulations
6-7-1: DEFINITIONS:
Whenever used in this Chapter, unless a different meaning appears from the
context, the following terms and phrases shall have the meanings herein
ascribed to them:
DEPENDENT UNIT: A mobile home which does not have bathroom or shower and toilet
facilities.
MOBILE HOME OR TRAILER COACH: Any coach, cabin, trailer, house car or other
vehicle or structure intended for or capable of human dwelling or sleeping
purposes, mounted upon wheels or supports, and/or capable of being moved by its
own power or transported by another vehicle; provided, that any structure
resting in whole or on permanent foundation, with wheels, tongue and hitch
permanently removed, shall not be construed as a trailer coach or mobile home.
MOBILE HOME PARK: Any park, court, camp, site, plot, parcel or tract of land
designed, maintained, intended or used for the purpose of supplying a location
or accommodations for more than two (2) mobile homes and shall include all
buildings used or intended for use as part of the equipment thereof whether or
not a charge is made for the use of the park and its facilities. "Mobile home
park" shall not include automobile or trailer or mobile home sales lots on
which unoccupied mobile homes are parked for purposes of inspection and sale.
NONDEPENDENT UNIT: A mobile home that has bath or shower and toilet facilities.
SPACE: A plot of ground in a mobile home park of not less than one thousand
(1,000) square feet of space designed for the location for only one automobile
and/or one mobile home.
UNIT: A mobile home unit. (1951 Code 12-11-1; Ords. 72, 72-14-18)
6-7-2: MOBILE HOME PARK LICENSE AND PERMIT PROVISIONS:
6-7-2-1: LICENSE TO OPERATE:
   A.   License Required: It shall be unlawful for any person to establish,
operate or maintain, or permit to be established, operated or maintained upon
any property owned, leased or controlled by him, a mobile home park within the
limits of the Village without having first secured a license for each such park
in accordance with the provisions of Section
3-1-1 of this Code.
   B.   Application for License:
      1.   The application for a mobile home park license or a renewal thereof
shall be made on forms furnished by the Village and shall include the
following:
         a.   The name and address of the owner in fee of the tract (if the fee
is vested in some person other than the applicant);
         b.   A duly certified statement by that person that the applicant is
authorized by him to construct or maintain the mobile home park and make the
application;
         c.   The names and addresses of the partners if it is a partnership,
the names and addresses of the officers if the applicant is a corporation, and
the present or last address of the applicant at the time of the filing of the
application; and
         d.   Such legal description of the premises upon which the mobile home
park is or will be located as will readily identify and definitely locate the
premises.
      2.   The application shall be accompanied by two (2) copies of the park
plan showing the following, either existing or as proposed:
         a.   The extent and area used for park purposes;
         b.   Roadways and driveways;
         c.   Location of units for mobile homes;
         d.   The proposed and existing facilities in the mobile home park for
water supply, sewage, garbage and waste disposal, fire protection and for a
sanitary community building which will include a description of toilets,
urinals, sinks, washbasins, slop sinks, showers, drains and laundry facilities,
the proposed alterations therein and the maintenance thereof.
         e.   Method and plan of sewage disposal;
         f.   Method and plan of garbage removal;
         g.   Plan for water supply;
         h.   Plan for electrical lighting of units and land upon which the
mobile home park is to be located;
         i.   If the existing or proposed camp is designed to serve
nondependent mobile home units, such plans shall clearly set forth the location
of all sewer and water pipes and connections;
         j.   The calendar months of the year in which applicant will operate
said mobile home park;
         k.   The plot plans of the trailer coach park, building plans and
specifications for existing buildings and facilities, and the plans and
specifications for new buildings and facilities or the proposed alterations in
existing facilities, all as may be required by the rules and regulations of the
Village under the provisions of this Chapter.
         l.   A statement of the fire fighting facilities, public or private,
which are available to the mobile home park.
      3.   An affidavit of the applicant as to the truth of the matters
contained in the application shall be attached thereto. Where a permit to
construct as well as an original license to operate is sought by the applicant,
request therefor shall be made in the same application. Each application shall
be accompanied by the appropriate fee 1 .
   C.   Inspections: No mobile home park license shall be issued until the
Chief of Police, Health and Sanitation Officer, Chief of the Fire Department,
and Director of Office of Quality Control, or their authorized agents, inspect
or cause to be inspected each application and the premises to determine whether
the applicant and the premises on which mobile homes will be located comply
with the regulations, ordinances and laws applicable thereto. No license shall
be removed without a reinspection of the premises. For the purpose of making
inspections and securing enforcement, such officials or their authorized agents
shall have the right and are hereby empowered to enter on any premises on which
a mobile home is located, or about to be located, and to inspect the same and
all accommodations connected therewith, at any reasonable time.
   D.   Transfer of Licenses: All licenses issued under this Chapter shall be
nontransferable without the written consent of the Village; provided, however,
that the Village may not withhold such consent where the provisions of this
Chapter have been met.
   E.   Suspension or Revocation of License, Hearing:
      1.   Notice of Suspension or Revocation: Any license granted hereunder
shall be subject to revocation or suspension by the Village; however, the
Village Clerk shall first serve or cause to be served upon the licensee a
written notice in which shall be specified the way or ways in which such
licensee has failed to comply with the ordinance or any rules or regulations
pertaining thereto. Said notice shall require the licensee to remove or abate
such nuisance, insanitary or objectionable condition, specified in such notice
within five (5) days or within a longer period of time as may be allowed by the
Village. If the licensee fails to comply with the terms and conditions of said
notice, within the time specified or such extended period of time, the Village
may revoke or suspend such license.
      2.   Public Hearing: A public hearing shall be conducted by the Village,
if written request therefor is made by the licensee, within five (5) days after
receipt of the Village notice. Any person refused a permit to construct or
alter a mobile home park or a license, or whose license is suspended or
revoked, shall have the right to a hearing before the Village Board. A written
notice of a request for such a hearing shall be served upon the Village within
thirty (30) days of such refusal of a permit to construct or alter, or refusal
of a license or suspension or revocation thereof. Written notice of such
decision shall be given, by mail, to the park operator or the applicant, as the
case may be, within five (5) days of such refusal, suspension or revocation.
The hearing shall be conducted by the Village Board under such rules and
regulations and procedures as it shall provide. (1951 Code 12-11-3, 12-11-4;
Ords. 72, 72-14-18, 81-12-19; 1985 Code)
 
Notes
1 1. See Section
  3-1-1-7 of this Code.
6-7-2-2: PERMIT TO CONSTRUCT:
   A.   Permits Required, Application:
      1.   No person shall construct a mobile home park without first obtaining
a permit to do so from the Director of Office of Quality Control.
      2.   No change in any sanitary facilities, methods of water supply,
sewage, drainage, garbage or waste disposal, and no change in the plot plan
shall be made without first making a written application to the Village and
receiving a written permit therefrom. Such application shall be made in the way
and manner hereinbefore set forth; such change or changes shall comply with
such safety and sanitary code, codes, rules and regulations as are applicable
thereto. No application fee shall be required to accompany an application for a
permit to alter a mobile home park where such alteration involves only a
reduction in the number of trailer spaces to a number less than such trailer
coach park is currently licensed for. Such change or changes shall comply with
such safety and sanitary code, building codes, rules and regulations as are
applicable thereto. Such permit does not relieve the applicant from securing
building permits or from complying with any zoning or other ordinance
applicable thereto.
   B.   Inspections: If a permit to construct a mobile home park has been
issued, the applicant, upon completion thereof, shall notify the Village. The
Village shall then inspect the mobile home coach park and if completed in
accordance with the accepted application, the Village shall issue a license.
(1951 Code 12-11-3; Ords. 72, 72-14-18, 81-12-19)
6-7-2-3: ISSUANCE OR DENIAL OF LICENSE OR PERMIT:
Upon receipt for an application for a permit to construct a mobile home park or
an application for a license to operate and maintain the same, the Village
Clerk shall, if the park is or the proposed park will be, in conformity with
this Chapter and the rules and regulations adopted by the Village pursuant
hereto, issue a permit to construct or a license, as the case may be. If the
application for a permit to construct or a license is declined, the Village
Clerk shall give the reasons therefor in writing to the applicant; and if the
objections can be corrected, the applicant may amend his application and
resubmit it for approval. (1951 Code 12-11-3; Ords. 72, 72-14-18)
6-7-2-4: DISPLAY OF LICENSES AND PERMITS:
All permits to construct, all licenses to operate and all permits to make
alterations in trailer parks shall be prominently displayed in the office of
the mobile home park. (1951 Code 12-11-3; Ords. 72, 72-14-18)
6-7-3: LOCATION:
   A.   No mobile home or mobile home park shall be located in any fire
district.
   B.   No occupied mobile home within the limits of the Village shall be
located between the recognized setback line for the zoning district in which
such mobile home is located and the street or highway, and in no circumstances
shall the minimum setback be less than five feet (5') from the side lot lines
of the mobile home park, nor less than ten feet (10') from any building or
other mobile home or from the boundary line of the premises on which located,
nor less than ten feet (10') from a public street or alley. (1951 Code 12-11-5;
Ords. 72, 72-14-18)
6-7-4: PARK PLAN:
   A.   Surface Drainage: Every mobile home or mobile home park shall be
located on a well- drained area and the premises shall be properly graded so as
to prevent the accumulation of storm or other waters. No mobile home or mobile
home park shall be located in any area that is situated so that drainage from
any barnyard, outdoor toilet or other source of filth can be deposited in its
location.
   B.   Mobile Home Site Requirements: Each trailer coach shall be allotted a
site of not less than one thousand (1,000) square feet, shall be clearly
defined and shall have a width of not less than twenty feet (20'). Each
individual trailer site shall abut or face on a driveway or roadway of not less
than twenty four feet (24') in width, which driveway or roadway shall have
unobstructed access to a public highway or alley. All streets and driveways in
every trailer coach park must be graveled or paved, and must be maintained in a
passable and reasonably dust-proof condition at all times, and all streets and
driveways in every trailer coach park established after January 1, 1954 shall
have a minimum width of twenty feet (20'). All streets and driveways in parks
constructed after August 21, 1967 shall have a minimum of twenty four feet
(24'). Such streets, driveways or roadways shall be maintained in good
condition, having storm sewers or natural drainage, and be well illuminated
during the hours of darkness.
   C.   Location of Dependent Units: The park shall be so laid out that no
dependent unit shall be located farther than two hundred feet (200') from the
toilets and service buildings provided for herein, and walkways to such
buildings shall be graveled or paved and well lighted at night. (1951 Code 12-
11-6; Ords. 72, 69-5-10, 72-14-18)
6-7-5: SERVICE BUILDINGS AND ACCOMMODATIONS:
   A.   Every mobile home park designed to serve dependent units shall have
erected thereon suitable buildings for housing toilets, lavatories, showers,
slop sinks and laundry facilities as required by this Chapter; such buildings
to be known as service buildings. Service buildings shall be located not more
than two hundred feet (200') from any dependent unit space, nor closer than
fifteen feet (15') from any mobile home space. Such buildings shall be of
permanent construction and adequately lighted, screened and ventilated.
   B.   There shall be provided separate toilet rooms for each sex. Water flush
toilets shall be required and shall be provided for each sex in the ratio of
one toilet for each eight (8) dependent units or fraction thereof and shall
have separate compartments, properly separated from other water closets, and
shall be not less than three feet (3') wide and shall be enclosed with proper
partition. Every male toilet room shall also contain one urinal for each
sixteen (16) dependent units but in no case shall any male toilet be without
one urinal. Toilet rooms shall contain lavatories with hot and cold water in
the ratio of one lavatory to every two (2) or less water closets.
   C.   Separate bathing facilities for each sex shall be provided with one
shower enclosed in a compartment at least four feet (4') for each eight (8)
dependent units or fraction thereof. Each shower compartment shall be
supplemented by an individual dressing compartment of at least twelve (12)
square feet. The floor of such compartment shall be waterproof and elevated
three inches (3") above the floor of the shower stall or a six inch (6")
curbing provided, separating shower compartment from dressing room. Mats, grids
and walkways made of wood, cloth or other absorbent materials will not be
approved for use in bath sections of community service buildings.
   D.   Laundry facilities shall be provided in the ratio of one double tray
unit and one conventional type washing machine, or one automatic washing
machine, with electric outlet, for each eight (8) units. Sufficient drying
facilities shall be available. No laundry tray shall be located in a toilet
room or bathroom.
   E.   Slop sinks for disposal of liquid wastes originating at the units shall
be provided in a separate room of the service building in the ratio of one slop
sink for each sixteen (16) dependent units.
   F.   The above accommodations shall be based on the total park capacity
according to accepted plans.
   G.   Floors of toilets, showers and the laundry shall be of concrete tile or
similar material impervious to water and easily cleaned. Concrete curbings
extending at least six inches (6") above the floor shall be provided and the
floor sloped to adequate drains. (1951 Code 12-11-8; Ords. 72, 75, 69-5-10, 72-
14-18)
6-7-6: ACCESSORY STRUCTURES AND IMPROVEMENTS:
   A.   Temporary porches, canvas-roofed canopies and skirts shall be permitted
for trailer coaches, and auxiliary rooms may also be authorized by regulation
of the Village if constructed of fire-resistant materials of such
specifications as shall be required by such regulations.
   B.   No mobile home shall be improved with a permanent foundation or lean-to
other than screens and awnings which shall be of fire- resistant materials.
(1951 Code 12-11-6; 1969 Code 12-21; Ords. 72, 72-14-18)
6-7-7: UTILITIES:
   A.   Water Supply:
      1.   An adequate supply of pure water, furnished through a pipe
distribution system connected directly with the public water main with supply
faucets located not more than two hundred feet (200') from any dependent mobile
home, shall be furnished for drinking and domestic purposes in all parks. Each
independent mobile home site shall have a cold water tap at least four inches
(4") aboveground.
      2.   Individual water service connections provided for direct use of an
independent unit shall be so constructed that they will not be damaged by the
parking of such units. Such systems shall be adequate to provide twenty (20)
pounds' pressure per square inch and capable of furnishing a minimum of one
hundred twenty five (125) gallons per day per space.
      3.   No common drinking vessels shall be permitted, nor shall any
drinking water faucets be placed in any toilet room.
      4.   Every mobile home park serving dependent units shall provide an
abundant supply of hot water at all reasonable hours for bathing, washing and
laundry facilities.
   B.   Sewer Regulations:
      1.   All liquid waste from showers, toilets, laundries, faucets,
lavatories, etc., shall be discharged into a sewer system extended from and
connected with the public sewer system. No water or waste shall be allowed to
fall on the ground from a mobile home.
      2.   Every space designed to serve a nondependent unit shall be provided
with sewer connections which shall comply with all applicable plumbing
regulations. The sewer connection shall be provided with suitable fittings so
that watertight connections can be made. Such connections shall be so
constructed so that they can be closed when not connected and trapped in such a
manner as to be maintained in an odor-free condition.
      3.   All sanitary facilities in any unit which are not connected with a
public sewer system by approved pipe connections shall be sealed and their use
is hereby declared unlawful.
      4.   Each faucet shall be equipped with facilities for drainage of waste
and excess water.
   C.   Garbage Disposal:
      1.   A sufficient number of adequate flyproof and watertight containers
shall be supplied for the storage of garbage except where an adequate
incinerator is provided.
      2.   Garbage containers shall be emptied at least every three (3) days
and shall not be filled to overflowing or allowed to become foul smelling or a
breeding place for flies. Garbage and rubbish shall be disposed of in a manner
which creates neither a nuisance nor a menace to health and which is approved
by the Department.
      3.   Adequate insect and rodent-control measures shall be employed. All
buildings shall be fly and rodentproof and rodent harborages shall not be
permitted to exist in the park.
   D.   Electrical Facilities:
      1.   Electrical outlets for each individual trailer site shall be
provided and the installation shall be in compliance with all State and local
electrical codes and ordinances 1 . No connected electric extension cord shall
lie on the ground or be suspended less than seven feet (7') from the ground
above sidewalks or pathways.
      2.   Every mobile home space shall be furnished with an electric service
outlet. Such outlet shall be equipped with an externally operated switch or
fuse of not less than thirty (30) amperes' capacity, and a heavy duty outlet
receptacle. Electrical outlets shall be weatherproof and no power lines shall
be less than fifteen feet (15') above ground. The entire electrical system
shall meet the minimum requirements of the State and local electrical codes.
(1951 Code 12-11-7, 12-11-9; 1969 Code 12-19; Ords. 72, 75, 72-14-18)
 
Notes
1 1. See Title 6, Chapter 2 of this Municipal Code.
6-7-8: COMMUNITY DINING FACILITIES:
Any mobile home park providing community dining facilities shall comply with
State and local regulations applicable to eating establishments 1 . (1951 Code
12-11-9; Ords. 72, 72-14-18)
 
Notes
1 2. S.H.A. ch. 56 /2, and Title 8, Chapter 2 of this Municipal Code.
6-7-9: DUTIES OF PARK ATTENDANT AND LICENSEE:
Every trailer coach park shall be in charge of a responsible attendant or
caretaker at all times, whose duty it shall be to maintain the park, its
facilities and equipment in a clean, orderly and sanitary condition and be
answerable, with the licensee, for any violation of the provisions of this
Chapter.
It is hereby made the duty of the attendant or person in charge together with
the licensee, to:
   A.   Keep a register of all guests, to be open at all times to inspection by
State, Federal, Municipal or school district officers which shall show for all
guests:
      1.   Names and addresses.
      2.   Number of children of school age.
      3.   State of legal residence.
      4.   Dates of entrance and departure.
      5.   License numbers of all mobile homes and towing or other vehicle and
the state issuing such licenses.
      6.   Purpose of stay in park.
      7.   Place of last location and length of stay.
      8.   Place of employment of each occupant.
The register shall be signed by each adult occupant and said record shall be
kept available for inspection for six (6) years. Any person furnishing
misinformation for purposes of registration shall be deemed guilty of a
misdemeanor and punishable under the general statutes or ordinances for such
offense. The registration records shall be neatly and securely maintained, and
no registration records shall be destroyed until six (6) years have elapsed
following the date of registration. The register shall be available at all
times for inspection by law enforcement officers.
   B.   Maintain the park in a clean, orderly and sanitary condition at all
times and maintain a temperature of at least sixty eight degrees (68) F. in all
service buildings during the period from October 1 to May 1.
   C.   Insure that the provisions of this Chapter are complied with and
enforced and report promptly to the proper authorities any violations of this
Chapter or any other violations of law which may come to his attention.
   D.   Report to the Health and Sanitation Officer all cases of persons or
animals affected or suspected of being affected with any communicable disease.
   E.   Prohibit the lighting of open fires on the premises.
   F.   Assume full responsibility for maintaining in good repair and condition
all sanitary and safety appliances on said park, and promptly bring such action
as is necessary to prosecute or eject from said park any person or persons who
wilfully or maliciously damage such appliances, or any person or persons who
fail to comply with the regulations of this Chapter.
   G.   It shall be the duty of each licensee on February 1 and September 1 of
each year, to file with the school board or boards of the school district or
districts wherein the mobile home park is located, a report giving the names
and ages of all children of school age living in said park. (1951 Code 12-11-
10; 1969 Code 12-33; Ords. 72, 72-14-18, 83-17-42; 1985 Code)
6-7-10: INVESTIGATIONS BY SCHOOL AUTHORITIES:
The governing body of the school district or governing bodies of the school
districts in which a mobile home park is located, by and through its officers,
attendance officers and proper employees, may inspect and visit a mobile home
park for the purposes of examining the register with reference to children of
school age for the purpose of enforcing attendance of school children housed in
the park. When a mobile home park is located in two (2) or more school
districts, the school district boards of said districts, acting jointly, shall
be and are hereby authorized to proceed under the provisions of this Section.
(1951 Code 12-11-11; Ords. 72, 72-14-18)
6-7-11: PARK OFFICE, RULES AND REGULATIONS POSTED:
In every mobile home park there shall be located the office of the attendant or
person in charge of said park. A copy of the park license and of this Chapter
shall be posted therein and the park register shall at all times be kept in
said office. Health rules and regulations of the Village and any change or
changes made from time to time shall be posted by the management in a
protected, conspicuous place within the trailer coach park. (1951 Code 12-11-
10; Ords 72, 72-14-18)
6-7-12: RECORDS KEPT:
The Director of Office of Quality Control and Clerk shall keep a record of all
mobile home parks, which records shall show the names and addresses of all
mobile home parks, names and addresses of the licensees, number of trailer
coach lots in each park, source of water supply, system of sewage and garbage
disposal, and any other information required by this Chapter or deemed
essential by the Village. (1951 Code 12-11-3; Ords. 72, 72-14-18)
6-7-13: PARKING RESTRICTIONS:
   A.   It shall be unlawful, except as provided in this Chapter, for any
person to park any mobile home on any street, alley, highway or other public
place, or on any tract of land owned by any person, within the Village.
   B.   Emergency or temporary stopping or parking is permitted on any street,
alley or highway for not longer than one hour subject to any other and further
prohibitions, regulations, or limitations imposed by the traffic and parking
regulations or ordinances for that street, alley or highway.
   C.   No person shall park or occupy any mobile home on any premises which is
situated outside an approved mobile home park. The parking of only one
unoccupied mobile home in an accessory private garage building or in a rear
yard is permitted providing no living quarters shall be maintained, or any
business practiced, in said mobile home while such mobile home is so parked or
stored.
   D.   No mobile home unit shall be parked in a park outside of a designated
space. (1951 Code 12-11-2, 12-11-6; Ords. 72, 72-14-18, 81-12-19)
6-7-14: APPLICABILITY OF OTHER REGULATIONS:
All plumbing, electrical, building and other work on or at any park required to
be licensed under this Chapter shall be in accordance with the ordinances of
the Village and the regulations of the State Health Department. Licenses and
permits granted under this Chapter grant no right to erect or repair any
structure, to do any plumbing work or to do any electrical work. (1951 Code 12-
11-12; Ords. 72, 72-14-18)
6-7-15: PINE TREE MOBILE HOME COURT RULES AND REGULATIONS:
The following rules and regulations shall apply exclusively to the licensees of
the Pine Tree Mobile Home Court owned and operated by the Village:
   I.   Your monthly rent is due on the first day of each month. You may pay
your rent at the Village Hall, Monday through Friday, eight thirty o'clock (8:
30) A.M. to five o'clock (5:00) P.M. A late charge of ten dollars ($10.00) will
be imposed without notice to you if you do not pay your monthly rent within
five (5) days after the rent is due. The late charge may be waived for good
cause by the Village.
   II.   Electricity and gas are metered and billed directly to you by the
service companies.
   III.   Metal storage units are permitted if you obtain the written approval
of the Village. You must obtain the approval before you erect any metal unit.
You must keep your metal storage unit in good condition at all times.
   IV.   No fences of any type are permitted.
   V.   You may store anything under your mobile home unless there is aluminum,
steel or fiberglass skirting placed around your entire trailer. The skirting
must match your mobile home. Storage under you mobile home is limited to items
of fire-resistant materials.
   VI.   Your visitors must park their vehicles outside the mobile home park.
Vehicles of visitors who violate this rule shall be ticketed and towed away.
   VII.   No outdoor clothes lines or clothes drying is permitted. You may not
hang wash on the railings or stairways leading into your mobile home.
   VIII.   Use of the laundry room is for you and the other licensees only. The
following laundry room rules must be adhered to:
      A.   Hours are eight o'clock (8:00) A.M. to ten o'clock (10:00) P.M.,
seven (7) days per week.
      B.   Rules for proper use of the machines are posted on the laundry room
wall over the machines. You must adhere to these rules.
      C.   The washers fill automatically. You may not ever add additional
water to the washers.
      D.   The laundry room must be kept clean at all times. You must remove
all items which you have brought in with you.
      E.   The Village has installed a lock on the laundry room door for your
protection. You must use a key to gain entry to the laundry room and must use
the key in order to leave the laundry room. You must keep the door closed at
all times.
      F.   Laundry room keys are issued by the office of the Director of Public
Works of the Village.
      G.   The Director of Public Works will issue laundry room keys only to
licensees registered with his office.
      H.   Only registered licensees are permitted in the laundry room. Any
person in the laundry room who is not a registered licensee is subject to
immediate removal.
      I.   If you allow persons who are not registered licensees to use your
key to the laundry room, you will be required to return your key to the
Director of Public Works and will forfeit your privilege of using the laundry
room.
For your own safety, do not open the laundry room door for anyone trying to get
in without a key.
   IX.   You must regulate the noise level of your radio and television set
during the day so as to avoid alarming or disturbing other licensees. The noise
level of your radio and television set must be kept low after ten o'clock (10:
00) P.M. each day. Outdoor television antennas are permitted on your mobile
home if you have obtained the prior approval of the Village. Other antennas and
CB units are not allowed.
   X.   You are responsible for any destruction or vandalism by your children
or your visitors. Children and visitors are not permitted to alarm or disturb
other licensees or their visitors.
   XI.   Bicycle riding is not permitted within the trailer park.
   XII.   The Village is not responsible for your lost or stolen articles. The
Village will prosecute theft to the full extent of the law.
   XIII.   Gambling, public intoxication, drinking in public and public
indecency, use of drugs and possession are not permitted. Violators of this
rule will be prosecuted by the Village to the full extent of the law.
   XIV.   No mechanical repairing or overhauling of motor-operated vehicles or
other motor- operated apparatus is permitted in the trailer park.
   XV.   You may not plant hedges, landscaping or greenery without the prior
written approval of the Village. You are responsible for the maintenance and
upkeep of your yard and must keep your yard neat and clean at all times. Your
grass is to be cut as frequently as necessary to maintain a neat and clean
appearance of your lawn. You may not have a vegetable garden. You may not plant
vegetation or greenery in front of your trailer.
The Village will impose a service charge for its time and equipment if it must
clean up or cut the grass on your lot.
   XVI.   You may not sub-lease your mobile home or mobile home lot.
   XVII.   If you wish to sell your mobile home while it is located on the
trailer park lot, you must first obtain written permission from the Village.
The Village is not required to rent a trailer park lot to anyone who purchases
your mobile home. Therefore, before a purchaser of your mobile home takes
possession of the trailer park lot, he or she must have an interview with the
park manager and must be approved by the Village. In addition, the new
purchaser must sign a lease agreement with the Village and must pay the
required deposit.
   XVIII.    No animals or fowl shall be kept in the trailer park.
   XIX.   No boat, travel trailer or truck is permitted to be kept in the
mobile home park. You may park any automobile in the mobile home park, provided
that you park on the driveway or in a designated parking area, and not on the
street or on any lawn.
Inoperative, unlicensed or unused vehicles must be removed from the trailer
park. The Village shall impose a charge for towing and storing of any vehicle
which it removes from the trailer park as being in violation of this rule.
   XX.   The hot water in the laundry room is for use in the laundry room only;
no hot water may be taken from the laundry room.
   XXI.   The speed limit for automobiles in the trailer park is ten (10) miles
per hour.
   XXII.   No commercial activity of any kind whatsoever shall be permitted or
conducted on or from any trailer without prior written consent from the
Village.
   XXIII.   You must register with the park manager all your guests whose stay
exceeds seventy two (72) hours (3 days). You are responsible for the conduct of
your guests.
   XXIV.   You may not install an air conditioner on your mobile home without
prior written approval of the Village. In order to obtain approval of the
Village, you must submit a written note from your neighbor on the side of your
mobile home on which the air conditioner is to be installed, stating that your
neighbor has no objection to the noise factor of the air conditioning unit.
   XXV.   Persons who are not registered licensees of the mobile home court are
not permitted in the mail room. Persons found in the mail room in violation of
this rule shall be immediately removed from the mail room and are subject to
arrest for trespassing.
   XXVI.   These rules are intended for the benefit of all licensees and
therefore these rules will be strictly enforced. If you do not comply with any
of these rules, you are subject to eviction from the mobile home court in
accordance with the law.
If you observe anyone violating any of these rules, you are requested to notify
the Village immediately so that proper action may be taken. (Ords. 78-24-61,
82-23-82)
CHAPTER 8
SIGNS AND ADVERTISING STRUCTURES

6-8-12:    Outdoor Illuminated Signs
6-8-13:    Ground Signs
6-8-14:    Pole Signs
6-8-15:    Wall Signs
6-8-16:    Roof Signs
6-8-17:    Projecting Signs
6-8-18:    Marquees
6-8-19:    Awnings And Canopies
6-8-20:    Transportation Shelters And Advertising Signs
6-8-21:    Temporary Signs
6-8-22:    Mobile Signs
